str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
